Though from this fire rises greatness; warriors of legend, leaders whose names will be ingrained in history, pioneering inventors, and a city that may yet be the cradle of the future.

In Golden Age players take on the roles of the leaders of emerging city-states in the ancient Greek world. Beset from all sides, they must put away their differences if they are to weather the coming storm. Will you work together with your fellow Greek to grow, nurture and protect your world? Or will you be a zealous hegemon and write your own history? Either way Greece must stand to see the dawning of a new age or there will be no tomorrow.

Name: Short Rules
Description: This is a rule book for miniature wargames in the Napoleonic period.  The book contains the rules, tables and charts needed to recreate battles in the Napoleonic era.  The book is written by Leon Tucker.

Name: Afghanistan 2010
Description: Card game for 2 Players. One player is the Americans. The other player is the Taliban. 2006-2010+ Simulation of the ongoing conflict in Afghanistan following the Taliban resurgence after the US led Invasion in 2001. Players recruit allies and steal or neutralize their opponents allies. The player with the most points worth of allies at the end of the game wins. Action and Event cards modify attacks and card play. Every Ally has a special ability that gives you an edge in the conflict. Influence tokens are used to recruit Allies as well as draw extra cards and get extra attacks.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Topologic
Description:
Topologic is a game of logic and deduction, but also uses piece movement.

Every game is played over two rounds. In the first round one player plays the role of the referee (who hides a secret), the other the role of the seekers. In the second round the roles reverse.

The 5 seekers are moved across the playing field (an assembled area of connected Nestortiles). Then the referee counts the score of the currently occupied locations (1 point for a color and/or number match) and announces the sum of the scored points. As they get more information, the seekers can deduce where the secret is hidden.

Topologic is abstract, but players are encouraged to come up with a thematic background they like. This even includes renaming the game for each session.

Name: Manufacture
Description:
Manufacture is an economic simulation game where players compete in variant aspects of the manufacturing process. Their decisions concern the production cost (setup, materials purchases, wages, rents), the sales (volume and value), the cash flow, the research of new products and optimization of current production, the financing of their actions, etc.

These tough economic decisions are being unfold over a factory layout where the positiong of the different modules is also important. The manufacturing process involves different stages of processing, routing and the efficient worker allocation.

There are 3 different types of goods (raw materials, intermediate goods and final goods) which are traded between the players and the outer world (in all directions) via contracts or a free market.

Name: Rabbit
Description:
Rabbit is a cooperative game for 1-2 players.
(from the website)
 It is Spring and You are the leader of a herd of rabbits that needs to recover if it is to survive the next Winter.  Your herd was once over twenty strong but disease and predators have brought you down to your last four rabbits. To make matters worse, humans and their machines have been approaching and your warren may be in grave danger.
  To win the game, you must have 12 or more Rabbits in play at the end of the last turn. Each game consists of 37 turns representing the weeks between Spring and Winter. You will need to make efficient use of your rabbits' abilities to Collect Food, Produce New Rabbits, and Explore New Areas if your herd is to survive.
  The challenge in Rabbit comes not from competition with other players but from the game itself. Rabbit can be enjoyed as a 1 player game or as a cooperative 2 player game. ( in a 2 player game, 1 player controls the Thinker and the other player controls Scouts and Fighters )

Name: Pancha Keliya
Description:
Ancient boardgame from India meaning "The game of five". The goal of the game is to collect 3 pieces in a treasure island. The game play is simple: the player throws the 6 special dice and put his pieces in the path. Captures are possible too, and the winner is the player that moves all 3 pieces to his island.

A Sri Lankan race game for two players. It has elements of Ludo-type games, in as much that you both start with three men and you win by getting all three 'home'. The board is unusual, in that it is not a 'circle', rather it is a track of 31 spaces, with some spaces marked as castles and you are safe from being sent home on them.

Name: Quest Júnior
Description: Quiz game for kids inspired by Trivial Pursuit. The mechanic is like a race where the players must answer questions and advance the pawn if the answer is correct. The first player to reach the last space and answer the chalenge question correctly is the winner.

Name: Acerte o Acento
Description:
Educational game where kids must use correct accentuation and backtick.

At the start of the game, each player receives a pawn and four cards. Each player must roll the dice and move the pawn. There are four kinds of spaces: opponent color, all colors, your color and take a card. If the pawn falls in one of the first two, the player must try to answer correctly a word in one of the opponents cards. The player with most point after 3 rounds is the winner.

Name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3085
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

In December 3076, Devlin Stone marshaled the nations of the Inner Sphere and began Operation SCOUR. The two-year final push to Terra was the bloodiest fighting seen in centuries. In the end, Terra had been freed with the Word of Blake scattered to the darkest corners of the universe. Stepping into that vacuum, Stone forged a new "Terran Hegemony" in The Republic of the Sphere. With the end of the Jihad, the survivors are rebuilding their shattered armies, introducing new machines to replace those whose factories ceased to exist in the fires of the Jihad.

BattleTech Technical Readout: 3085 gives a detailed look at the machines introduced during the waning days of the Jihad and into the founding days of Devlin Stone’s Republic of the Sphere. This book includes the latest ’Mechs, battle armor, aerospace and vehicles as well as new late-Jihad support vehicles. In addition, this sourcebook heralds the long-awaited update of Technical Readout: Project Phoenix, featuring brand-new art and additional variants. Conventional infantry make their Technical Readout debut with fifty-six individual infantry formations from classic foot infantry to xeno-planetary soldiers. And finally, after more than twenty years of silence, Land-Air BattleMechs explode back into a Technical Readout with a look at the original four LAMs and their Star League history.

Name: Word.Nut
Description:
In a Nut Shell - This game is all about making WORDS. 
It's fun to play and quick to learn.

Your objective is to make as many words as you can by using the  ‘Nuts’ provided within a pre-set time deadline.   (10 minutes, 30 minutes, or even days at a time - you decide.)

Play Word.Nut as a SOLO or MULTI player game.   All players play AT THE SAME TIME.


     Mix all the Nuts around inside the Word.Nut shell.   Then open the zipper and leave open.  
     Each player or team takes a ‘lucky dip’ to gather a supply of 12 Nuts (no peeking). 
     Set your own stopwatch or timer to notify you after the agreed playing time.
     Play. Make Words. Go nuts. 
     Play till time runs out or all of the Nuts are used up.
     The winner is the person who achieves the highest score for the words they have made.  The game rules show a clear scoring chart.  


Invented in New Zealand by BERRY.

Name: The Goonies Board Game
Description:
From the Wired.Com review of The Goonies 25th Anniversary Edition DVD Set:

".... the set’s true treasure - a special Goonies-themed board game.

The bulk of the box set’s real estate is devoted to this game, and immediately upon cracking open the shrink wrap you are taken by its diminutive size. Still, if The Goonies taught us anything it’s that size doesn’t always matter, and I’m happy to report that this is the case here. Though the board itself is only about half the size of your average game, it’s actually a brilliantly colored fold-up printed on super sturdy laminated stock that appears perfectly capable of standing up to multiple years’ worth of play sessions. The same can be said for the game’s Move Cards which, while not quite as brawny as most CCG cards, are thick enough to get the job done.

Gameplay is fairly simple and properly reflects the spirit of the source materials - players take the role of one of five Goonies (Mikey, Data, Mouth, Chunk or Andy) and use a three-card hand in an attempt to escape One-Eyed Willy’s cave. Players disarm traps to collect Gold Doubloons, and the first to reach the "Escape" square with three such Doubloons wins the game. The process is complicated by a trio of tricky Skull Spaces (only one of which contains the necessary key) that must be passed to reach the exit. This is balanced out by a fun selection of Special Move Cards that allow players to switch places with or steal gold from opponents. While certainly not the most engaging board game experience in movie fandom, it does manage to channel the proper amount of nostalgia and charm in a small but effective package."

Name: Sea Ranger
Description:
Sea Ranger is a new type of game, where learning is entertaining and family fun.  The world's oceans our are largest single resource.  If they are abused, mis-managed or ignored; we on land will be worse off for our neglect of this wonderful planet.

Sea Ranger can teach or remind us all of our place in this world; how we use the oceans and waterways; the balance of life and our needs; raise our awareness of how mankind neglects or abuses these incredible places.

Within, on and around our oceans and rivers, hide a multitude of life, living in a state of balance, growing and evolving.  Mankind is upsetting this balance to dangerous levels.

Learn, have fun with friends and family, share this knowledge and make a difference in this world.

What is Sea Ranger?

Sea Ranger is a board game designed to educate and entertain 2-6 players about the amazing and diverse wildlife that inhabits the oceans and waterways creating a giant circle of life.  We can also learn how mankind uses and abuses this incredible resource we all share.

Sea Ranger is a multi-facetted game.  Not only are the players learning about the aquatic environment, they are also learning about themselves.  Players learn many qualities of character that are required to either win or prevent collective loss among the players.  They share the responsibilities, successes and benefits.

Players learn:;

To share and care for resources.

Collective and individual responsibility.

Manage resources.

To maintain a balance of life and needs.

Value life in all forms as part of the wealth of this world.

Respect each players participation and support.

The best part is that it is fun doing this.

Who Can Play?

The game is aimed at children from 8 years and over and adults.  Children will require guidance to assemble.

Children quickly master the rules.

So how does it all work?

The game gives players knowledge and choices.  Players can easily discern what feels right or is the right thing to do.  We all know within our hearts what is right and good, even if we don't know the answer.

The game uses a special board and tokens.  You print out the board and pieces on your colour printer, then cut and assemble the components.  To make them last longer or be more durable you may mount them on card or laminate the pieces.  Teach the children skills as they read instructions and learn to cut out the pieces.

The game is directed by a special card deck which will present players with a series of events and choices.  The players must decide how they will resolve these, sometimes this may require teamwork and sharing.  There are many different strategies you can use to win, some can be very quick, others slower.

Part of the game revolves around maintaining the circle of life, ensuring a balance of species to enable life to continue.  Each creature is part of that circle and has a unique role to play.

Players must then try and balance mankind's intervention and damage to the seas and waterways.  It is a careful juggling act; players individually cannot hope to keep the balance so you need to play cooperatively.

What Do I Get?

Sea Ranger is 26-page colour PDF plus a small rules booklet.   The game requires you to print 16-pages to create the board, cards & tokens.  Included is the deluxe card set giving you the choice of finish.  Where possible we have tried to minimise the graphical content to save ink.  Ideally the major components are printed on card.  Some simple assembly is required.

(Edutainment Games, www.edutainment-games.com)

Name: Tribal Dice
Description:
Tribal Dice is a unique new solitaire and interactive multiplayer game where players use eight dice with eight sides (8d8) in various colors.  The dice represent tribal spirits that must be restored in an ancient ritual to save the tribe and determine the new chieftain.  A spirit is fully restored when it shows the highest number, and when it shows that number, each one grants the player a different special power that can be invoked one time to influence the other dice in the game.  Players can also re-roll matching dice.

Victory is predicated on strategic planning for which dice to re-roll, when and what order to invoke special powers, and some luck.  The solitaire game provides a score, whether won or lost, that a player can attempt to improve over successive games.  The multiplayer game has an adjustible game length and a high level of interaction.

Although current electronic implementations of the game allow only solitaire and three player multiplayer, it is possible to play with any number of players, and a special "chaos rule" allows for large groups to play the game without any downtime, as they can invoke their special powers out of turn order.
